meanings.definition: To make someone so frightened that they are unable to move or think
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm petrified the little girl, freezing her in fear.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie petrified the audience, causing them to jump in their seats.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house tour guide pretended to be petrified of the fake spider, making the visitors laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news of the test results petrified her like a statue, unable to react.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the dark forest petrified him, feeling like time had stopped.

meanings.definition: To change organic matter into a stony concretion by the infiltration of water carrying mineral particles
meanings.sent1: Over time, the ancient tree trunk petrified, turning into a solid rock-like structure.
meanings.sent2: The fallen leaves in the swamp slowly petrified, becoming fossilized over centuries.
meanings.sent3: The muddy footprints on the riverbank seemed to petrify into stone, fooling the curious explorer.
meanings.sent4: The wooden shipwreck began to petrify underwater, transforming into a mineralized relic.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant coral reef petrified into a ghostly white formation, a testament to environmental changes.
